titles.title: To encourage the negotiated settlement of tribal claims.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

bill.summary: 3/5/2002--Introduced. States that reconciliation reports received by an Indian tribe in response to requirements under the American Indian Trust Fund Management Reform Act of 1994 shall be deemed to have been received on December 31, 1999, for purposes of applying a statute of limitations in order to provide report recipients with the opportunity to postpone the filing of claims, to facilitate the voluntary dismissal of claims, or to encourage settlement negotiations with the United States.
